intro: Corrigiola poeppigii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Corrigiola poeppigii is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
